definition[0]: a small hole made accidentally in a tyre
note[0]: slow puncture (=one that lets air out very slowly)
example[0]: She was cycling home when she had a puncture.
definition[1]: a small hole made by a sharp point, especially in someone’s body
definition[2]: if a tyre punctures, or if you puncture it, a small hole appears in it
example[2]: A piece of glass punctured the back tyre.
definition[3]: to make a small hole in something
definition[4]: to interrupt a period of silence by making a noise
example[5]: There was a stunned silence, punctured by shrill laughter.
definition[5]: to suddenly destroy someone’s hopes or beliefs, making them feel unhappy, embarrassed, or confused
example[6]: He wasn’t hurt, but his dignity was punctured.
